chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
lb: list bool

Goal:
({k : nat & {tl : list bool | lb = list_repeat One k ++ Zero :: tl}} + {k : nat | lb = list_repeat One k})%type

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Inductive bool : Set := true : bool | false : bool
list_repeat : forall X : Type, X -> nat -> list X
tl : forall A : Type, list A -> list A
Notation Zero := false
Notation One := true
list_bool_choose : forall lb : list bool, {k : nat & {tl : list bool | lb = list_repeat Zero k ++ One :: tl}} + {k : nat | lb = list_repeat Zero k}
destruct_list : forall (A : Type) (l : list A), {x : A & {tl : list A | l = x :: tl}} + {l = nil}
bool_ring_ring_lemma1 : forall (n : nat) (l : list bool) (lpe : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr bool * Ring_polynom.PExpr bool)) (pe1 pe2 : Ring_polynom.PExpr bool), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) eq (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N One andb) l lpe ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N One andb) l pe1 = Ring_polynom.PEeval Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N One andb) l pe2
bool_ring_ring_lemma2 : forall (n : nat) (lH : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr bool * Ring_polynom.PExpr bool)) (l : list bool), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) eq (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N One andb) l lH ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N One andb) l pe = Ring_polynom.Pphi_dev Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) Zero One bool_eq (IDphi (R:=bool)) (get_sign_None (C:=bool)) l npe
list_repeat_plus : forall (X : Type) (x : X) (a b : nat), list_repeat x (a + b) = list_repeat x a ++ list_repeat x b
xorb = fun b1 b2 : bool => if b1 then if b2 then Zero else One else if b2 then One else Zero : bool -> bool -> bool Arguments xorb (_ _)%bool_scope
ssrbool.is_inl = fun (A B : Type) (u : A + B) => match u with | inl _ => One | inr _ => Zero end : forall A B : Type, A + B -> bool Arguments ssrbool.is_inl {A B}%type_scope
BoolTheory = {| Radd_0_l := fun x : bool => if x as b return ((if b then One else Zero) = b) then eq_refl else eq_refl; Radd_comm := fun x : bool => if x as b return (forall y : bool, xorb b y = xorb y b) then fun y : bool => if y as b return (xorb One b = xorb b One) then eq_refl else eq_refl else fun y : bool => if y as b return (xorb Zero b = xorb b Zero) then eq_refl else eq_refl; Radd_assoc := fun x : bool => if x as b return (forall y z : bool, xorb b (xorb y z) = xorb (xorb b y) z) then fun y : bool => if y as b return (forall z : bool, xorb One (xorb b z) = xorb (xorb One b) z) then fun z : bool => if z as b return (xorb One (xorb One b) = x...
list_pick : forall (X : Type) (ll : list X) (k : nat), k < length ll -> {x : X & {l : list X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ x :: r /\ length l = k}}}
pow2_2n1_dec : forall n : nat, {p : nat & {b : nat | S n = pow2 p * (2 * b + 1)}}
is_true = fun b : bool => b = One : bool -> Prop Arguments is_true _%bool_scope
list_split_length : forall (X : Type) (ll : list X) (k : nat), k <= length ll -> {l : list X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ r /\ length l = k}}
map_cst_repeat : forall (X Y : Type) (y : Y) (ll : list X), map (fun _ : X => y) ll = list_repeat y (length ll)
div2 = fix div2 (n : nat) : nat * bool := match n with | 0 => (0, Zero) | 1 => (0, One) | S (S n1) => let (p, b) := div2 n1 in (S p, b) end : nat -> nat * bool Arguments div2 _%nat_scope
map_duplicate_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (ll : list X) (l' : list Y) (y1 : Y) (m' : list Y) (y2 : Y) (r' : list Y), map f ll = l' ++ y1 :: m' ++ y2 :: r' -> {l : list X & {x1 : X & {m : list X & {x2 : X & {r : list X | l' = map f l /\ y1 = f x1 /\ m' = map f m /\ y2 = f x2 /\ r' = map f r /\ ll = l ++ x1 :: m ++ x2 :: r}}}}}
seq = fix seq (start len : nat) {struct len} : list nat := match len with | 0 => nil | S len0 => start :: seq (S start) len0 end : nat -> nat -> list nat Arguments seq (_ _)%nat_scope
exists_last : forall (A : Type) (l : list A), l <> nil -> {l' : list A & {a : A | l = l' ++ a :: nil}}
map_list_repeat : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (x : X) (n : nat), map f (list_repeat x n) = list_repeat (f x) n
list_app_cons_eq_inv : forall (X : Type) (l1 l2 r1 r2 : list X) (x : X), l1 ++ r1 = l2 ++ x :: r2 -> {m : list X | l1 ++ m = l2 /\ r1 = m ++ x :: r2} + {m : list X | l2 ++ x :: m = l1 /\ r2 = m ++ r1}
Init.Nat.mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.mul (_ _)%nat_scope
list_choose_dec : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop), (forall x : X, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> forall ll : list X, {l : list X & {x : X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ x :: r /\ P x /\ (forall y : X, In y l -> ~ P y)}}} + {forall x : X, In x ll -> ~ P x}
O_or_S : forall n : nat, {m : nat | S m = n} + {0 = n}
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
map_middle_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (ll : list X) (m : list Y) (y : Y) (n : list Y), map f ll = m ++ y :: n -> {l : list X & {x : X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ x :: r /\ map f l = m /\ f x = y /\ map f r = n}}}
Fin.to_nat_of_nat : forall h : ?p < ?n, Fin.to_nat (Fin.of_nat_lt h) = exist (fun i : nat => i < ?n) ?p h where ?p : [lb : list bool |- nat] ?n : [lb : list bool |- nat]

```coq
destruct (list_bool_choose lb) as [k tl|k].
- exists k. exists tl. reflexivity.
- exists k. reflexivity.
Qed.```
